benchmark_details.name: USDC (User Stance and Dogmatism in Long Conversations)
benchmark_details.overview: USDC is a dataset curated from 764 long multi-user Reddit conversation threads for studying user opinion fluctuations, annotated for stance and dogmatism classification tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Analyze Reddit conversations to identify user stances on sociopolitical topics and determine their level of dogmatism.

data.source: Reddit conversation threads in English from 22 different subreddits.
data.annotation: Annotated using majority voting based on LLM outputs from models like GPT-4 and Mistral Large.

methodology.calculation: F1 scores are calculated based on predicted stance and dogmatism labels compared to true labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate improved model performance in correctly classifying user stances and dogmatism.
methodology.baseline_results: Un-fine-tuned models demonstrated an F1 score of ~0.3; fine-tuned models achieved scores improving significantly, e.g., 56.2 for stance.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement evaluated using Cohen's kappa score.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User identities are anonymized by not including personal demographic details, focusing on post IDs only.
